bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John R. Bullard, June 4, 1941

div1.p: Hench thanks Bullard for the photographs, but requests that Bullard autograph them for posterity and identification purposes.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John R. Bullard, June 4, 1941
div1.opener:
Y F
June 4, 1941
Mr. John R. Bullard
P. O. Box 59
St. Augustine, Florida
My dear Mr. Bullard:
div1.p:
You're a peach to send me the splendid copies
of your photographs that I requested. As you know, I
plan to use them when I finally get around to writing up
my studies on yellow fever. I am trying to get photographs
of all the volunteers. I am very glad to have yours for
this purpose.

I am going to return these photographs and ask
that you autograph them for me, with your name underneath
the photograph. I should not only like to have the honor
of your autograph, but it will serve as a permanent mark
of identification, as these photographs will be preserved
with the rest of my yellow fever data long after I am gone.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
